name: David Arbour
body:
## About Me
I am currently a PhD candidate, working in the [Knowledge Discovery Laboratory](http://kdl.cs.umass.edu) at the [College of Information and Computer Sciences(http://cs.umass.edu) of UMass Amherst. My advisor is [David Jensen](https://people.cs.umass.edu/~jensen/). My research interests lie in causal learning in relational data, nonparametric dependence testing and statistical relational learning.

## Publications
* Marazopoulou, Katerina, David Arbour, and David Jensen. "Refining the Semantics of Social Influence." arXiv preprint arXiv:1412.5238 (2014).
* Arbour, David, Marazopoulou, Katerina, Garant, Daniel and Jensen, David. "Propensity Score Matching for Causal Inference with Relational Data." UAI 2014 Workshop Causal Inference: Learning and Prediction. 2014.
* Maier, Marc, Marazopoulou, Katerina, Arbour, David and Jensen, David. "Flattening network data for causal discovery: What could go wrong?." Workshop on Information in Networks. 2013.
* Maier, Marc, Marazopoulou, Katerina, Arbour, David and Jensen, David. "A Sound and Complete Algorithm for Learning Causal Models from Relational Data." Uncertainty in Artificial Intelligence. 2013.
* Arbour, David, Atwood, James, El-Kishky, Ahmed and Jensen, David. "Agglomerative Clustering of Bagged Data Using Joint Distributions." (2013). Proceedings of the workshop on Machine Learning with Graphs (MLG).
* Dickson, P. E., Arbour, D. T., Adrion, W. R., & Gentzel, A. (2010). Evaluation of automatic classroom capture for computer science education. In Proceedings of the fifteenth annual conference on Innovation and technology in computer science education (pp. 88-92). ACM.
* Dickson, P. E., Adrion, W. R., Hanson, A. R., & Arbour, D. T. (2009). First experiences with a classroom recording system. In ACM SIGCSE Bulletin(Vol. 41, No. 3, pp. 298-302). ACM.
